text:
So much of North Carolina's unique beauty comes from our state's public lands.

On National Public Lands Day, let's recommit ourselves to protecting our parks, monuments, and natural areas so future generations will always be able to enjoy these beautiful spaces. https://t.co/lFmqNLFLXa

Shanah Tovah! I'm wishing all those celebrating in North Carolina's 12th Congressional District a happy, healthy, and sweet new year.

May this season of renewal bring you and your family peace, happiness, and good health. https://t.co/6IlKAG6qQd

Today, I was proud to introduce the bipartisan, bicameral National Stillbirth Prevention and Awareness Day resolution in Congress dedicated to bringing an end to preventable stillbirth across the country.

Learn more about our work here: https://t.co/dTx8VzJczD https://t.co/sxj3Ru2nnR

I cannot support a continuing resolution that causes my constituents to lose their healthcare.

Read my statement about voting against the CR here: https://t.co/gwyt305iTx https://t.co/W8AtH9ggvc

My office is hiring for a District Administrative Assistant and a District Staff Assistant based out of our Charlotte District Office.

Please see here for more information: https://t.co/1cAombu32F https://t.co/2g23M7jwaf

Today, I joined my colleagues in introducing the bicameral Capital for Beginning Farmers and Ranchers Act.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/aZQ8jPtfjL https://t.co/9ggrXQv3Q5

Happy #HispanicHeritageMonth!

This month, we honor our Hispanic communities' contributions to our country and celebrate their powerful role in the telling of the American story.

I am honored to host tomorrow's district's 2025 Military Service Academy Day for high schoolers and recent graduates who live or attend school in North Carolina's 12th Congressional District!

Learn more and RSVP here: https://t.co/LzLYf6afjo https://t.co/b2wBaBom9R

I am distressed to learn that colleges and universities across the country are being forced into lockdown due to credible threats of violence against their campuses. 

I am actively monitoring these situations and am praying for the safety of everyone.

We honor the victims, their families, and the first responders who served on 9/11 today and every day by working toward a freer, safer world.

In the face of attacks, I am always proud of the indominable American spirit we carry with us. https://t.co/dlqUdJEzlQ

Political violence has no place in our country. 

My prayers are with Charlie Kirk’s friends, family, and everyone who witnessed this horrible act of violence.

For the first time, we are having a hearing on SNAP and options to states.

Make no mistake, this should have happened well before Republicans in Congress made unprecedented cuts to SNAP. https://t.co/OPAPXIGMaS

I will continue working with leaders at all levels of government to provide for the public safety of our district, including accessible, well-funded mental health services. We owe it to our community to always make their health and safety our top priority.
We must be intentional about safeguarding the wellbeing of Charlotte and Mecklenburg County, and that begins with strong partnerships at the local, state, and federal level.

I am grateful to see the Charlotte City Council and Metropolitan Transit Commission take actionable steps today to address safety and security in our public transit system, and my office is ready to support them however we can.
Our Charlotte community mourns the tragic loss of Iryna Zarutska and my prayers are with her friends, family, and loved ones at this difficult time.

Today, I joined @RepJahanaHayes, @RepSummerLee, @NydiaVelazquez, & @SenGillibrand in introducing the Closing the Meal Gap Act aimed at modernizing and increasing SNAP benefits.

Hunger is a policy choice and today, we are choosing to provide for the people who need it most. https://t.co/fm70v4bBRW

I am honored to host our district's 2025 Military Service Academy Day for high schoolers and recent graduates who live or attend school in North Carolina's 12th Congressional District!

Learn more and RSVP here: https://t.co/LzLYf69HtQ https://t.co/x4d6lvtBSY

68 years ago, Dorothy Counts bravely walked through the doors of Harding High School in Charlotte, integrating the all-white school.

May we all embody her courage in the face of hate & remember the words her father said to her:

"Hold your head high. You are inferior to no one." https://t.co/XcejaDuigt

I just stepped out of the Education & Workforce Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education hearing to update you.

We know that a lot of the kids who are left behind actually start behind. Meanwhile, we’re talking about cutting millions of dollars from our schools. https://t.co/tvku5FRa4X

On #LaborDay, be sure to thank a union.

For paid leave.

For workplace safety and discrimination protections.

For Social Security and Medicare.

For child labor laws.

For living wages and 8-hour workdays.

Labor rights are human rights and when unions win, we all win. https://t.co/jxLW2nPkRs

Labor Day reminds us of the power workers share.

Some of our most hard-fought rights—weekends, workplace protections, overtime, living wage—were won by American laborers coming together for the betterment of our country

Thank you for your service. https://t.co/eevtgFzqjY

For 135 years, the Second Morrill Act of 1890 has helped build equity in education through supporting our land grant HBCUs.

We must ensure every land grant HBCU is given the funding they're owed through this act so they can continue providing for their students and communities.

Last week, I was honored to speak at the Sprouts Grand Opening in NoDa.

Sprouts represents the first sizeable grocer in NoDa in more than two decades, addressing a longtime food desert in the region. https://t.co/h7jX897tnQ

The March on Washington was one of the most powerful demonstrations in American history, showing the unwavering strength we have when we come together.

To honor Dr. King's legacy, we must continue to march, to speak, and to fight to build a more just, more equitable future. https://t.co/CZad4FM8WG

70 years ago,   14-year-old Emmett Till was lynched and his murderers were never held   accountable for their heinous crime.

To honor   Emmett Till's legacy, we must work together to stop the rise in hate crimes   our country faces and ensure America remains safe for everyone.
America is the only developed country in the world where this continues to happen. We owe it to our children, teachers, and parents to act and we must act now. Their lives depend on it.
Schools are supposed to be sanctuaries of education but in their first week back, two young students have already tragically lost their lives from another mass shooting.
My prayers are with the people of Minnesota, the victims, and their families after today’s horrific shooting at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis.

This week, I met with housing leaders in our district to discuss our efforts to address homelessness and housing instability in the Charlotte-Mecklenburg region.

Affordable housing protects the health, safety, and dignity of our residents and we must protect and expand it. https://t.co/DqETKqMNAp

Today, I introduced the Black Breastfeeding Week resolution alongside @RepBonnie recognizing August 25, 2025 through August 31, 2025 as Black Breastfeeding Week.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/cGDs9goZwW https://t.co/PVypj9XXV2

Today, we celebrate 106 years of the National Park Service. 

The NPS is a promise made to future generations that we will always preserve the history & natural beauty of our country. I am committed to protecting the NPS & call on all of my colleagues in Congress to do the same. https://t.co/1GeQfmoq1i

I'm wishing all our @CharMeckSchools students a great start to the school year today! 

Remember the words of W.E.B. Du Bois, "Of all the civil rights for which the world has struggled and fought for 5,000 years, the right to learn is undoubtedly the most fundamental." https://t.co/pw8uxmM1hC

President Trump fundamentally misunderstands the role museums play in telling the story of America.

Museums are centers of preservation, culture, and speaking unapologetically to the history of our country—its greatest achievements & its darkest moments.

https://t.co/nYshOFIC87

Today, I released a statement on DHS Secretary Kristi Noem withholding more than $100 million in funds already approved by FEMA for Hurricane Helene recovery efforts in Western North Carolina.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/S82FURbJMN https://t.co/qg8wunhMcq

I was honored to deliver the keynote for the Durham Committee on the Affairs of Black People on their 90th anniversary and speak more on their theme—Power, Resilience and Moving Forward—during this critical time for our country. https://t.co/IkBbQ9rNcJ

105 years ago, the 19th Amendment enshrined women's right to vote in America, placing us in charge of our futures for the first time in our country's history. 

We must never take this hard-fought right for granted, and commit ourselves to showing up at the ballot box. https://t.co/ltDisnViOp

I believe access to nutritious food is a human right. We must end the humanitarian aid blockade in Gaza so we can end the starvation & malnutrition crisis hundreds of innocent civilians, including children, have already died from.

https://t.co/1yPbhdNW9E

Social Security was a promise made to the American people on August 14, 1935, 90 years ago—today, President Trump and Republicans in Congress are trying to break that promise.

You have spent your career paying into Social Security and you are entitled to the money you’re owed. https://t.co/R6Ibt3qOgm

Access to pharmacies is an essential part of healthcare in Charlotte. 

Yesterday, I toured one of @NACDS' pharmacies in our district and discussed the future of medicine access for our community.  We must ensure pharmacies remain accessible to everyone who calls our city home. https://t.co/iNRh9Sj6ZT

Today, I led a letter with Reps. Crockett, McBath, and Pressley on extreme heat protections for incarcerated people in federal prisons.

Read the full letter here: https://t.co/t1Lze9wPM0 https://t.co/ov9mS3QylW
They have been a longtime pillar in Charlotte, especially for our underserved communities, and I want to thank them for hosting today’s event and for all the work they do.
For 11 years, C.W. Williams Community Health Center has hosted this incredible event, providing healthcare and school supplies to our families and children ahead of the new school year.

I’m grateful that no one was injured at C.W. Williams’ Back to School Community Health Fair after the reported shooting and I want to thank the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department for their quick response to the incident.

Today, I led a letter with Rep. Tokuda calling for the USDA to reverse the reckless elimination of the Regional Food Business Center program.

The loss of funding has disrupted vital partnerships and threatened local and regional supply chains. https://t.co/ZGGuT70sW3

For 60 years, Medicare and Medicaid have given millions of Americans access to the vital healthcare services they need to thrive.

While Republicans are trying to eliminate coverage for 16 million Americans, I am committed to protecting and expanding it. https://t.co/F3mCGsv1UU

Today, we celebrate the 35th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, a landmark legislation that continues to champion inclusion and accessibility for all.

Today, I remain committed to ensuring equal rights and opportunities for all Americans.

I’m proud to see these education funds finally released so we can better support our students, schools & communities.

Today, we won that fight but the work isn’t over. We will continue holding this administration accountable. Our children’s educational future depends on it. https://t.co/IjyU1RITL6

The federal minimum wage hasn’t increased since this day in 2009. That’s over 15 years without a raise, while the cost of living keeps climbing. It's time for a new minimum wage that reflects today’s reality.

Meeting Nelson Mandela was one of the most important moments in my life that has defined my own dedication to public service.

As we celebrate Mandela Day, let us never stop fighting to make his vision for a World free of injustice and inequality a  reality.

Republicans’ decision to defund public broadcasting today only serves to abandon communities facing natural disasters in the future, especially rural Americans, and they should be ashamed.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/J3xAxnGiFc https://t.co/1pUuuqMl86

Today marks 11 years since Eric Garner's tragic death, a stark reminder of the work still needed to address police brutality and racial injustice. Let's honor Eric's memory by continuing to fight for accountability and reform. #BlackLivesMatter

Today, I joined my colleagues alongside union workers to discuss our new bill to to protect workers from extreme heat.

As we face record temperatures, it has never been more important that we protect our workers facing extreme heat in the workplace.

https://t.co/gdNl5fG9UF

Our small, mid-sized, and family farms are the backbone of our economy, but the Trump Administration has chosen to abandon them by defunding the Regional Food Business Centers. 

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/uWI6RLOcEM https://t.co/aCYp6icSrH

Today, I sent a letter with @RepDeborahRoss, @ValerieFoushee, and @RepDonDavis calling on Senate leadership to strike cuts to public broadcasting in the rescissions package to keep NC safe during emergencies.

Read our full letter here: https://t.co/D47YsYBBDj https://t.co/dT5B8HLZDd

60 years ago, the Older Americans Act was signed into law.

The OAA protects the dignity of all of our older Americans, including their healthcare, housing, and economic stability.

I will always stand by our older Americans and fight for their security, dignity, and future.

One year ago today, my bipartisan Stillbirth Prevention Act was signed into law.

The SPA has been essential in combatting the silent crisis of stillbirth & we still have more work to do.

Let's work together to bring an end to the stillbirth crisis & protect our moms & children. https://t.co/AaNwFJ7DKC

12 years ago, I brought a coat hanger to the NC House floor to show my Republican colleagues what would happen if their dangerous abortion ban went into effect.

12 years later, I am still as committed to protecting abortion rights for everyone—because abortion is healthcare. https://t.co/wvK3Dh7g75

I was appalled and disappointed to learn that the USDA is no longer taking remediation steps for race- and sex-based discrimination in farm lending, conservation grants, loans, and other programs.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/IvsRQIsmuI https://t.co/xV160D6gDo

For too long, Black women have been forced to work twice as hard to get half as far, facing steep barriers, discrimination, and lack of opportunity to succeed.

I’m proud to introduce the Black Women's Equal Pay Day Resolution and continue our fight for wage equity in America. https://t.co/TmgiXJ2Cew

The One Big Ugly Bill is a complete betrayal of my constituents and every single person who calls North Carolina home.

This bill isn’t just budget line items; it represents people who will be hurt by these reckless, unprecedented cuts.

My statement here:
https://t.co/HpeAdaCLB1

I just tried to make an amendment to the budget bill on the House floor that would protect against any cuts to Medicaid and SNAP.

Republicans wouldn't entertain it.

We are going to keep fighting this One Big, Ugly Bill. https://t.co/WKXjIBDsFG

If this budget bill passes, North Carolina will suffer.  

People will lose their healthcare. Prices will go up. People will not be able to eat because SNAP is going to be demolished. https://t.co/ZUuiIGS6nO

The One Big, Ugly Bill is bad for North Carolina.

❌ 663,000+ NC Medicaid recipients would lose their healthcare.
❌ $500M+ in new SNAP costs that the NC would be forced to pay.
❌ 238,000 NC college students would see their student loan payments doubled or tripled. https://t.co/EaTz7iB3Es

The budget bill could cost North Carolina more than $500M to keep SNAP running for our state and threatens food security for 1.4 North Carolinians on the lifesaving food security program.

Read the full letter here: https://t.co/VaHfihYqB2 https://t.co/arik1eTib8

I am proud to be inducted into the Order of the Long Leaf Pine and thank you to @NC_Governor for honoring me with this award. 

Here's to the land of the long leaf pine!

Gun violence affects everyone in every corner of our country. It upends lives and rips families apart. During National Gun Violence Awareness Month, I want you to know that I am fighting to end gun violence in America and keep our communities safe. https://t.co/mzPWpheAMm

Today marks a decade since the historic Obergefell v. Hodges decision that affirmed marriage equality nationwide.

Let's celebrate the love of all couples, regardless of gender, and recommit to upholding marriage equality no matter how hard they try to reverse it. #LoveWins

Today, I joined @RepDeborahRoss, @ValerieFoushee, and @RepDonDavis in a letter calling on Senate Majority Leader John Thune to eliminate the reckless cuts to Medicaid that will devastate NC's health care system.

Read the full letter here: https://t.co/YBFAMyZb10 https://t.co/JfH6DUym0q

I stepped out of my committee hearing on educational opportunities for Native Americans to update you.

If we're serious about providing equity and opportunity for these schools, we need to offer solutions, not just discussion. https://t.co/ItGhhZQQyQ

3 years ago today, the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. In one decision, decades of precedent and the constitutional right to abortion were erased. Since then, millions have faced forced pregnancies, clinic closures, criminalization and fear. Women in America deserve better. https://t.co/eJT1AI13VP
So this Juneteenth, let us celebrate this vital part of history that needs to be told and keep our eyes pointed toward a future where complete equality is realized.
By doing so, we ensure that the complexities and impact of American history will encourage public reform for the present and future.
As Americans, it is our responsibility to continue advocating and educating the next generation to promote voting rights, civil rights, and address systemic struggles.
The late, great Texas Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee introduced the legislation for Juneteenth to finally become a federal holiday. We pay tribute to her as we celebrate this day.

Today, around the country, people gather to commemorate Juneteenth, celebrating the full emancipation of enslaved African Americans in the U.S. in 1865. This day serves as an important reminder that no person should ever be left behind in our quest for freedom and equality. https://t.co/OpWUqtRoX1

My sister lost her life to sickle cell anemia at the age of 26. While much progress has been made since then, this disease continues to impact nearly 100,000 Americans.

On World Sickle Cell Day, we stand together to raise awareness for sickle cell disease. https://t.co/UJe0F91ifm

10 years ago, a white supremacist entered the historic Mother Emanuel AME Church in Charleston and killed nine worshipers.

As we continue the fight against racism, let's carry their memories forward.

Hate should have no place in America.

Happy Father's Day to all the amazing dads in the 12th District! Today, we celebrate the love, guidance, and strength you bring to our lives. Whether you're a biological dad, a stepdad, or a father figure, thank you for all you do! https://t.co/TNGtFPKqxZ
My prayers are with the Minnesota community, the victims, and their families after today’s tragic shooting.

Minnesota Speaker Melissa Hartman and her husband Mark lost their lives to an unspeakable act of political violence, while Sen. John Hoffman and his wife Yvette are in critical condition from the politically motivated shooting.
Political violence has no place in America and we must work together to bring an end to it. No one should live in fear of standing up for what they believe in.

There is no justification for federal agents assaulting Sen. Padilla.

This administration has weaponized the executive branch against our communities, citizens, & elected officials.

Republicans in Congress should join Democrats in demanding answers for this egregious action.

Today, I voted against the Republican recissions package that would recklessly cut $9.4 billion from the federal budget, harming foreign aid and public broadcasting.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/1TOp17z228 https://t.co/2mJzJa7Mht

Medgar Evers’s legacy of courage and resilience continues to inspire us today.

As we honor his memory, let's continue his march towards racial justice, equality, and the rights of all people.

His sacrifice will never be forgotten.

Today, we remember the lives lost in the tragic Pulse nightclub shooting– the deadliest hate crime against LGBTQ+ people in our nation’s history.

To honor their memories, I will continue to stand against hate and violence threatening LGBTQ+ individuals.

I stepped out of the Agriculture Committee hearing to update you on my conversation with USDA Secretary Rollins.

Some of the questions I asked her about SNAP were not answered. These cuts are going to hurt people and this administration needs to admit that. https://t.co/B04MV38YKf

On#EqualPayDay, we're reminded that women, particularly women of color, continue to make less than their male counterparts for the same work.

The fight for workplace equality is far from over, and I'm working hard to close the gender wage gap once and for all.

Donald Trump and Republicans have made it clear that they want to restrict access to contraception.

On the 59th anniversary of the landmark decision in Griswold v. Connecticut, I will continue to fight for access for all everyone.

A group of unelected, unconfirmed private citizens has no business accessing your sensitive data. 

Social Security is a lifeline for millions of Americans—seniors, widows, children, disabled workers—and we cannot and will not let it be undermined.

On this 81st anniversary of D-Day, let's pay tribute to the Allied forces who stormed the shores of Normandy and honor those who did not return home.

Their relentless determination and courage paved the way for the preservation of democracy and freedom around the world. https://t.co/eT0E6vG9Zz

Happy World Environment Day! Let's come together to celebrate and protect our precious planet. From reducing our carbon footprint to conserving biodiversity, I remain committed to climate action and building a better future for our children. https://t.co/jB5Sd7vXwX

I stepped out of the Education & Workforce Committee hearing to update you on my conversation with Labor Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer.

Workers need our support and I'm going to continue to fight for them. https://t.co/Apv0EwXbge

I just stepped out of our Education Hearing with Education Secretary McMahon to update you. 

Democrats are going to stay on it and make sure things happen for our kids, for our schools, and for our parents. https://t.co/2cOY0JDhB1
Mr. Rangel was inimitable and I know my colleagues and I will honor his legacy by continuing his steadfast work in Washington.

He broke barriers as the first African American Chair of the Ways and Means Committee and, as a founding member of the Congressional Black Caucus, he helped ensure African Americans had the representation and advocacy we deserve in our government.
I’m heartbroken to hear about the passing of former Congressman Charles B. Rangel. Mr. Rangel was a trailblazer whose impact can be felt throughout the halls of Congress.
Each Memorial Day, we honor the brave men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice for our freedom. Their courage and commitment will never be forgotten. https://t.co/53ysGd79wq

On this day, we remember George Floyd—whose life was stolen and whose name became a rallying cry for justice. His death sparked a global movement. His legacy lives on in the ongoing fight to end police brutality and build a more just, equitable world. https://t.co/ywd9qcbSuX

Today, Republicans chose to place greed over our country.

Millions of people will be harmed by the reckless GOP reconciliation budget. More children will go to bed hungry. More working Americans will lose their healthcare.

Read my full statement here: https://t.co/604afXUS23 https://t.co/CxUCaipJBc
My thoughts and prayers are with his family and the people of Fairfax during this difficult time. It was my pleasure to work with him.

I am heartbroken to hear about the passing of Congressman Gerry Connolly.

Rep. Connolly devoted his life to public service, working to build a better world for everyone—especially the most vulnerable among us.
We will not be intimidated and will not stop holding this administration accountable.

This administration seems to have issues with Black women lawmakers doing their job. I will continue to stand with Rep. McIver until these blatant, ridiculous, racist charges are dropped and proudly thank her for her courage.
The charges against Rep. LaMonica McIver are baseless and a blatant attempt to weaponize the Department of Justice against Members of Congress.

Since 1965, Head Start has empowered millions of children with the early education they deserve. On its anniversary, we reaffirm our commitment to protecting this critical program from Republican attacks because every child deserves a strong start. https://t.co/fnQfKG9KPr

71 years ago, Brown v. Board declared segregation unconstitutional. But separate and unequal still exists—in funding, outcomes, and opportunity. Our fight for access to education is far from over and I will raise my voice until everyone has access to a quality education. https://t.co/wABWLKoyfI

On #IDAHOT, we remember the lives lost to hate and stand firm against President Trump’s attacks on the LGBTQ community. It's time to end the discrimination and fight for the rights of every LGBTQ person to live without fear of violence and persecution. https://t.co/OlkJZPbQ2S

Today we honor the dedication, sacrifice, and service of the U.S. Armed Forces. Let’s commit to supporting our troops—not just in words, but with the care, resources, and respect they deserve. https://t.co/oTSLuksDSA

Stillbirth is one of the most heartbreaking things a parent can go through, and for those that have been through it—I see you, I hear you, and I want you to know that we’re fighting for you. https://t.co/mA2B9Yav1u

Through their tireless advocacy, we got our bill passed into law with near unanimous support. We need states to follow our lead and dedicate funding to ending this preventable crisis, because 1 in 4 stillbirths are preventable.

On the anniversary of the passage of my bill, the Stillbirth Prevention Act, I’d like to thank the Healthy Birth Day advocates (pictured here). This is a team of dedicated moms, many of whom shared with me their personal experiences with stillbirth.

I stepped out of our Agriculture Committee hearing to update you.  

Republicans are proposing a $330 billion cut to SNAP, a program that keeps over 1.5 million North Carolinians from going hungry. 

It's cruel, and I am going to fight back until the end. https://t.co/57RGBbmPGf

3 years ago, a white supremacist murdered 10 African Americans in a Buffalo grocery store. This wasn’t random—it was an act of racial violence. To remember the lives of those lost, we must continue to fight for gun reform, elect leaders with the courage to act, and combat racism.

This Sunday, I will be hosting the Grand Opening of the Congressional Art Competition Exhibition at the Mint Museum Uptown.

https://t.co/Jc3SR081fh

On this special day we celebrate mothers, grandmothers, great grandmothers and mother figures in the lives of others. We honor and cherish those whose devotion, faithfulness and sacrifices have contributed to our lives and enriched our stories.

The American Federation of Teachers turns 109 today! For the last century, AFT has championed educators, students, and public education. Here's to the union power that continues to fight for justice, equity, and strong schools.

Approved by the FDA in 1960, the birth control pill changed everything. 64 years later, the right to contraception is still under threat. I will never stop fighting until everyone has safe, accessible and affordable contraception.

55 years ago, four students were killed at Kent State while protesting the Vietnam War. We honor their memory and reaffirm the need to protect the right of all voices to speak out, organize, and feel safe—on campus and beyond.

On this day in 1961, the Freedom Riders, including my late colleague John Lewis, set out to challenge segregation in the South. Their courage ignited a movement and changed history. https://t.co/3lLYotk0xC

That’s just a fraction of what is at stake for North Carolina with this bill.
➡️Millions of dollars for rebuilding destroyed and damaged child care facilities and services affected by Helene – because child care is infrastructure.
➡️Millions of dollars in defense repairs to North Carolina military installations affected by Helene.
➡️$2.2 billion dollars for the Small Business Administration to help fund the $172 million in requested loans from over 2,000 North Carolina small businesses.
➡️Over $1 billion for the National Park Service to rebuild and preserve the Blue Ridge Parkway, and $429 million more for other NC parks projects.
➡️$674 million in disaster payments and economic assistance for the farmers who feed us from across the state.

A few more of the items that we stand to lose out on if we don’t pass this bill are:
➡️Over $1.6 billion for disaster recovery through Housing and Urban Development to assist with long-term housing, infrastructure, and economic recovery needs for hardest-hit communities.

North Carolina is recovering from the most devastating natural disaster in modern history- Hurricane Helene. Almost $9 billion – that's billion, with a “B” – in disaster relief funding for NC is in this bill, which we need desperately for rebuilding in the wake of Helene. 🧵⬇️
